title: Contributing Guide
text:
Thank you for your interest in contributing to The MealDB Python Library! We welcome contributions from everyone, and we’re excited to collaborate with you. This guide will help you understand how to get involved.


If you encounter any issues or bugs, please report them by opening an issue on our GitHub repository.
When reporting an issue, please include:

A clear and descriptive title.
A detailed description of the issue.
Any relevant screenshots or error messages.




We value your ideas! If you have a feature request, please open an issue and describe:

The feature you would like to see.
Why this feature would be useful.
Any examples or use cases.




We review pull requests regularly. Our review process ensures that the codebase remains clean, maintainable, and aligned with project goals. Please be patient as we review your contribution.

title: The MealDB Python Library
text:
The MealDB Python Library provides seamless access to The MealDB API, enabling developers to integrate a rich database of meal recipes into their applications. The library is designed for Python, making it easy to incorporate meal data into your projects.


Before getting started make sure that you have got your API_KEY from The Meal DB.
from mealdb import MealDB

mb = MealDB(API_KEY)
meal = mb.get_meal_by_name('Potato Salad')

print(meal)



We appreciate all contributions, from reporting bugs to implementing new features. Read our contributing guide to learn more.



This project is licensed under the terms of the CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0.

title: The MealDB Python Library
text:
Before getting started make sure that you have got your API_KEY from The Meal DB.
from mealdb import MealDB

mb = MealDB(API_KEY)
meal = mb.get_meal_by_name('Potato Salad')

print(meal)

text: We appreciate all contributions, from reporting bugs to implementing new features. Read our contributing guide to learn more.

title: list_all_meals
text:
MealDB.list_all_meals(letter)
Retrieves a list of meals starting with a specific letter from the MealDB API.











Name
Type
Description
Default




letter
str
The letter to search for (e.g. ‘a’, ‘b’, etc.).
required














Name
Type
Description




list
list
A list of meals starting with the specified letter.









Name
Type
Description





httpx.HTTPError
If the API request fails.

title: filter_by_area
text:
MealDB.filter_by_area(area)
Retrieves a list of meals that originate from a specific area from the MealDB API.











Name
Type
Description
Default




area
str
The area to filter by (e.g. Canadian, Mexican).
required














Name
Type
Description




list
list
A list of dictionaries containing the meals that originate from the specified area.









Name
Type
Description





httpx.HTTPError
If the API request fails.






This function uses the MealDB API to retrieve a list of meals that originate from a specific area. The API returns a dictionary containing the meals, which is then converted to a list and returned by this function.

title: MealDB
text:
MealDB(self, api_key)





Name
Description




filter_by_area
Retrieves a list of meals that originate from a specific area from the MealDB API.


filter_by_category
Retrieves a list of meals that belong to a specific category from the MealDB API.


filter_by_ingredient
Retrieves a list of meals that include a specific ingredient from the MealDB API.


get_latest_meal
Retrieves the latest meal data from the API.


get_meal_by_name
Retrieves a list of meals by name from the MealDB API.


list_all
Retrieves a list of all categories, areas, and ingredients from the MealDB API.


list_all_areas
Retrieves a list of all areas from the MealDB API.


list_all_categories
Retrieves a list of all categories from the MealDB API.


list_all_ingredients
Retrieves a list of all ingredients from the MealDB API.


list_all_meals
Retrieves a list of meals starting with a specific letter from the MealDB API.


list_meal_categories
Retrieves a list of meal categories from the MealDB API.


meal_details_by_id
Retrieves the details of a meal by its ID from the MealDB API.


single_random_meal
Retrieves a single random meal from the MealDB API.

title: MealDB
text:
Name
Description




filter_by_area
Retrieves a list of meals that originate from a specific area from the MealDB API.


filter_by_category
Retrieves a list of meals that belong to a specific category from the MealDB API.


filter_by_ingredient
Retrieves a list of meals that include a specific ingredient from the MealDB API.


get_latest_meal
Retrieves the latest meal data from the API.


get_meal_by_name
Retrieves a list of meals by name from the MealDB API.


list_all
Retrieves a list of all categories, areas, and ingredients from the MealDB API.


list_all_areas
Retrieves a list of all areas from the MealDB API.


list_all_categories
Retrieves a list of all categories from the MealDB API.


list_all_ingredients
Retrieves a list of all ingredients from the MealDB API.


list_all_meals
Retrieves a list of meals starting with a specific letter from the MealDB API.


list_meal_categories
Retrieves a list of meal categories from the MealDB API.


meal_details_by_id
Retrieves the details of a meal by its ID from the MealDB API.


single_random_meal
Retrieves a single random meal from the MealDB API.

title: get_latest_meal
text:
MealDB.get_latest_meal()
Retrieves the latest meal data from the API.










Name
Type
Description




list
list
A list containing the latest meal data, or a message indicating that the user needs to subscribe to access the endpoint.









Name
Type
Description





httpx.HTTPError
If the API request fails.

title: filter_by_area
text: This function uses the MealDB API to retrieve a list of meals that originate from a specific area. The API returns a dictionary containing the meals, which is then converted to a list and returned by this function.

title: filter_by_ingredient
text: This function uses the MealDB API to retrieve a list of meals that include a specific ingredient. The API returns a dictionary containing the meals, which is then converted to a list and returned by this function.
